document_title: Acute gastritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Some cases of acute gastritis do not present with obvious symptoms. However, in general, patients can be detected through the following common signs:
Stomach pain or discomfort; Heartburn.; Loss of appetite; Nausea, vomiting; Vomiting blood (occurs when inflammation leads to tears or the formation of deep ulcers in the stomach lining).; Abnormal weight loss.; Fever.; Unusual feeling of fullness in the stomach; Feeling full too quickly after eating; Passing black stools.
subsection_title: viem da day cap.json. Symptoms of acute gastritis

Some cases of acute gastritis do not present with obvious symptoms. However, in general, patients can be detected through the following common signs:
